Summary Highly motivated Facilities Engineering professional with key knowledge and experience in the areas of facilities mechanical systems and energy conservation. 
 
Results oriented self-starter with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to take an overall systems view to assess and improve operating efficiency of a mechanical system.  
 
Began working career installing and servicing HVAC equipment following Tech School. Hired by Digital Equipment as an HVAC Technician then moved into Project Management and Engineering positions while achieving BSME at night.  
 
Moved to Digital Hudson site as Project Manager and was soon recruited into a Mechanical Engineering role for the expansion of the Semiconductor Fab. Currently Facilities Sr. Mechanical Engineer for Intel in the same location. 
 
Achieved the Association for Facilities Engineering "Certified Plant Engineer" (CPE) and "Certified Professional Maintenance Manager" (CPMM) accreditations, as well as the Association of Energy Engineers "Certified Energy Manager" (CEM). 
 
Strong interest in Energy Conservation and an active member of the Intel Global Energy Team for ~10 years, leading efforts to reduce the Hudson site's annual energy costs by ~$6m in that role.  
 
I come from a Family of 5 children, and I am proud to say I have a wonderful Wife, 3 Sons, and 3 Grandsons to love and enjoy life with. -	Ensuring systems operate reliably to avoid manufacturing/ facility (or operations) impacts by meeting uptime goals. 
-	Overseeing projects to meet design criteria, scope, budget, and schedule; oversight of planning, design, reconfiguration, construction, maintenance, and modifications to equipment, machinery, facilities systems, buildings, and structures as required to support business requirements. 
-	Delivering operational efficiency, maintenance, testing and commissioning solutions; effective collaboration with construction and operations teams to coordinate work in the field; identify and implement opportunities to achieve lowest cost of ownership to key stakeholders while maintaining reliability. 
 
Additional portfolio: Energy Conservation Engineer 
 
Responsibilities: 
-	Providing energy efficiency advice and training. 
-	Liaising with contractors, facility engineer and operator and customers. 
-	Developing, implementing and monitoring energy consumption reduction policies and strategies. 
-	Analyzing data and collating information. 
-	Maintaining accurate records. 
-	Writing plans and reports. 
-	Undertaking energy surveys/site inspections. 
-	Keeping up to date with changes in legislation and initiatives. 
-	Promoting energy conservation awareness via events such as presentations, workshops and conservation projects and company newsletter. Project & Application Engineer BICT Engineering Sdn Bhd October 2011  –  April 2013  (1 year 7 months) Penang, Malaysia Responsibilities: 
 
-	Evaluate, organise and priortise workload within a schedule.

-	Interpret clients’ requirements. 
-	Take responsibility for a team of engineers.

-	Investigating problems and complaints. 
-	Provide technical support to the project team and wider regional teams. 
-	Responsible for overseeing the review, initiation and execution of contracts. 
-	Managing project budgets and keeping costs down. 
-	Responsible for the completion of all documentation. 
-	Producing Test Plans and reports. 
-	Write programming to the project eg. PLC, BMS programming.

There are three grades of membership: Honorary, Graduate, and Active. Honorary members are technical graduates actively engaged in engineering work; or members of mechanical engineering faculties. Graduate membership is conferred upon persons who would have been eligible had Pi Tau Sigma been established earlier in schools not having chapters, or upon those continuing graduate study. Active members are selected from the junior and senior mechanical engineering classes at their respective schools whose mechanical engineering curriculum must be accredited by ABET. Summary I have been working on facilities management and operations since 2002. Plant building and start up. Electromechanical systems maintenance and troubleshooting, building maintenance, people and contracts management, energy management and expense / capital budget management are part of my scope of work. 
 
I'm self motivated, issues solver and with a strong orientation to costumers striving to attend their requirements with a high sense of urgency. 
 
Looking forward for better communication abilities in order to improve the expectations between customers and the organization strategic objectives. 
 
Achievements 
- Recovering and operation a biological waste water treatment plant and a nitrogen destilating plant.  
- Management of the Facilities department for a medical devices manufacturing plant.  
- Starting from green field a 40k m2 medical manufacturing plant and supported all the mechanical construction activities and contractors. 
- Development of the entire maintenance and operations program for electromechanical systems required to support ISO class 7 & 8 clean rooms continuous operation. At this moment, I'm in charge of Facilities Sustaining operations of this plant with great contribution on cost savings thru energy conservation initiatives. Summary A Sr. Reliability Engineer with comprehensive technical abilities, people skills and global experience in Production Operations, Facilities Engineering, Project Management, Operational Excellence and Team Leadership. A creative leader able to conceptualize and secure new opportunities, resolve problems, increase revenue and reduce expenses. 
 
AREAS OF EXPERTISE 
• Project/Contract Management  
• Strategic Planning 
• Relationship Development  
• Staff and Team Development 
• Budget Development  
• International Program Implementation 
• Continuous Improvement/Six Sigma 
• Quality Systems  
• New Business Development  
 
PROVEN ACCOMPLISHMENTS 
Developed a new product enabling equipment modification to meet Customer needs. Conceptualized, designed and managed installation of new equipment components at Asian manufacturing facility. RESULTS: On time new product introduction with revenues increasing from $10 million to over $20 million annually over past four years. 
 
Implemented an OSHA Compliant Electrical Safety Program globally to reduce employee exposure to electric shock and ArcFlash hazards and to eliminate a non-compliance issue. Managed Engineering Consultant’s evaluation and documentation of the electrical systems hazard levels. RESULTS: Globally, no Energized Work Permits have been issued for the last five years and no employees have been injured doing electrical work. 
 
Analyzed the high failure rate of mixer seals with a global cost impact of $480,000 per year. Documented current replacement process and identified opportunities for reductions. Recommended bringing rebuild activities in-house, standardized seal installation procedures and trained personnel. RESULTS: Mixer seal parts and motor replacement costs were reduced by $350,000 per year.
